name: Timezone Scheduler
description: This module is intended to facilitate scheduling with support for multiple client timezones

project-settings.name: Configuration instance for each reservable appointment slot

sub_settings.name:
Slot DB Project ID
Enter the project_id on this server that contains the database of available reservation slots. The project MUST match the required project format (i.e. use the template to create any new slot projects)

Appointment ID Field
Field in this project that will hold the reserved appointment slot once selected by a user

Appointment ID Field Event
The event id where the Appointment ID Field above resides.
(If you wish to use the same Appointment Id Field in a form that is enabled on multiple events, you must create a configuration instance for each event)

Appointment Server DateTime Field
(Optional) Select a date/time field here and the selected appointment slot's date/time (in your server's timezone) will be stored. This can be used to automate reminders to the participant ahead of the appointment. This field must also be in the same event id specified above. This field MUST BE VALIDATED AS Y-M-D H:M - any other format may cause errors

Appointment Participant Formatted Date
(Optional) Select a text field (do not validate it as a date/time as this will fail!) and the nicely formatted string that the participant saw when selecting their appointment will be stored. This could be piped into a reminder email so the participant can see the appointment time in their selected timezone

Slot Record URL
(Optional) This field will contain a URL to the Slot Project for this slot ID. Useful for an admin to be able to jump to the Slot database.

Filter Expression
(to be developed) -- idea is that you could enter expression here that would be evaluated with the record's data and could be used to select a subset of available slots in the other database...

Disable
Check to disable this config without deleting it

project-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger

system-settings.name: Enable Debug Logging (system-wide)(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger
